definition: environmental sanitation/abbr. to 環衛|环卫[huan2 wei4]
ring/hoop/loop/(chain) link/classifier for scores in archery etc/to surround/to encircle/to hem in
to guard/to protect/to defend/abbr. for 衛生|卫生, hygiene/health/abbr. for 衛生間|卫生间, toilet
surname Wei/vassal state during the Zhou Dynasty (1066-221 BC), located in present day Henan and Hebei Provinces

sentences.english: International Journal of Toxicology, Occupational and Environmental Health.
sentences.chinese: 国际毒物学，职业与环境卫生杂志。

sentences.english: Poor sanitation conditions where they live.
sentences.chinese: 他们寓居环境卫生条件差。

sentences.english: Typhoid fever sneaks in when sanitation fails.
sentences.chinese: 环境卫生搞不好，伤寒就会乘虚而入。

sentences.english: Article 10 This Municipality adopts the system of responsibility zones of city appearance and environmental sanitation.
sentences.chinese: 第十条本市实行市容环境卫生责任区制度。

sentences.english: His work covered areas such as environmental health.
sentences.chinese: 他的工作涉及环境卫生等领域。

sentences.english: Their habitancy sanitation condition is bad.
sentences.chinese: 他们寓居环境卫生条件差。

sentences.english: Continuous borrowing suction device used material, greatly improves sanitation.
sentences.chinese: 采用吸风装置连续采料，大大提高环境卫生。

definition: to make green with plants/to reforest/(Internet slang) Islamization
